title: Great phone.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 12, 2023

text: Got my husband this phone as an early birthday/Christmas gift. He’s never had a phone that cost more than $400 and this present came as a big surprise. After seeing the camera and screen quality, I’m probably going to jump ship on the iPhone bandwagon I’ve been on for the last decade once I’m up for an upgrade. I seriously cannot emphasize how great the picture quality is and the sound is incredible. I downloaded tiktok and snapchat on it, to see if posted videos lagged (like all typical androids) but they actually looked crispier on the 22+ Ultra than my iPhone 13+… Only downside that my husband immediately noticed was the size and mentioned how probable a drop was going to be, but I got him a durable case and popsocket that’s hopefully helps mitigate that. He won’t stop thanking me for the gift so it’s safe to say that this was worth the investment! Now the only reason why I’m unwilling to rate it 5 stars is because the 45W charger isn’t included with the phone to aid fast battery charging and Samsung downgraded the ram from 12GB to 8GB from last year’s Galaxy S21 5G Ultra… obviously not a big difference but these changes just prove the company wants to siphon more money out of consumers.
title: 5 Star Quality but 4 Star Overall
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 20, 2022

text: Package arrived when expected in immaculate condition. The performance of the phone is as the many reviews say but what stands out is the eSim capability.
